meanings.definition: Not submissive to rule or control; disobedient; turbulent
meanings.sent1: The classroom was chaotic with the unruliest students refusing to follow the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent2: The unruliest child in the group always caused trouble during playtime.
meanings.sent3: The unruliest puppy in the litter kept running away from its owner in the park.
meanings.sent4: The unruliest storm of the season caused widespread damage to the town.
meanings.sent5: Her unruliest hair stood out in all directions, refusing to be tamed by a brush.

meanings.definition: Difficult to control or govern; disorderly
meanings.sent1: The unruliest traffic jam made everyone late for work that morning.
meanings.sent2: The unruliest garden in the neighborhood was filled with overgrown plants and weeds.
meanings.sent3: Trying to organize the unruliest pile of papers on his desk was a never-ending task.
meanings.sent4: The unruliest group of kids at the party kept running around and knocking things over.
meanings.sent5: Her unruliest thoughts kept her awake at night, making it hard to relax.
